subject: Re: [junit] JUnit not matching to my needs - execute order shows 	design flaw ?
msgSnippet: ... Marking them as special assertions might make it clearer that they are incidental, and not part of the point of the test. Instead, they verify that the
messageBody:
David Plass wrote:

> How does adding 'assumptions' and 'corollaries' help? They're just asserts,
> after all, right?

Marking them as "special assertions" might make it clearer that they are
incidental, and not part of the point of the test. Instead, they verify
that the test fixture is correctly setup. There's a clue in that last
sentence.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services

Let's write software that people understand
